Class ec.util.Set 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.util.Set
public abstract class Set
extends Object
This is a set implemented via hashing. It is abstract so as to be able to have its particular hashing and equality checks defined by subclasses. The two provided concrete versions are IdentitySet--based on == and System.identityHashCode()--and EqualsSet--based on Object.equals() and Object.hashCode().

See Also:
EqualsSet, IdentitySet

Set()
Constructs a new, empty set, with a reasonable set of defaults.
Set(int, double, int)
Construct a new, empty set, with the specified parameters.

clear()
This clears out the set so that it has no elements in it.
contains(Object)
Returns true if the specified object is an element of the set, as defined by the equality function of the set.
elements()
Return an enumeration of the elements in the set.
get(Object)
Gets the object in the table that is equal to the given one, as defined by the equality function of the set, or null if there is no such object.
isEmpty()
Return true if the set contains no elements.
performEquals(Object, Object)
This method must be overridden by subclasses to define the way to compare two objects for equality.
performHashCode(Object)
This method must be overridden by subclasses to define the way to get a hashCode.
put(Object)
Put the given object into the set.
remove(Object)
Removes the given object (or its equivalent, according to the set's equal function) from the set.
removeOne()
This removes and returns one element from the set.
size()
Get the number of elements in the set.

Set 
 public Set(int initialCapacity,
            double loadFactor,
            int maxProbes)
Construct a new, empty set, with the specified parameters.

Parameters:
initialCapacity - the initial number of elements the set should be prepared to hold
loadFactor - a number between 0.0 (exclusive) and 1.0, defining the threshold for growing the set's underlying array.
maxProbes - the maximum number of probes into the set's underlying array to make. Larger numbers mean slower performance but better memory usage.
Throws: IllegalArgumentException
thrown if initialCapacity <= 0
Throws: IllegalArgumentException
thrown if loadFactor <= 0 or loadFactor > 1
Throws: IllegalArgumentException
thrown if maxProbes <= 0
Set 
 public Set()
Constructs a new, empty set, with a reasonable set of defaults.

size 
 public int size()
Get the number of elements in the set.

Returns:
the number of elements in the set.
isEmpty 
 public boolean isEmpty()
Return true if the set contains no elements.

Returns:
true if the set contains no elements.
elements 
 public Enumeration elements()
Return an enumeration of the elements in the set.

Returns:
the enumeration
contains 
 public boolean contains(Object value)
Returns true if the specified object is an element of the set, as defined by the equality function of the set.

Parameters:
value - the object to look for
Returns:
true if the value is in the set
Throws: NullPointerException
thrown if value == null
get 
 public Object get(Object value)
Gets the object in the table that is equal to the given one, as defined by the equality function of the set, or null if there is no such object.

Parameters:
value - the object to look for
Returns:
nullOk; the equivalent value in the set, or null if there is no such object
Throws: NullPointerException
thrown if value == null
put 
 public Object put(Object value)
Put the given object into the set. If the value is equivalent (according to the set's equal function) to a value already in the set, the equivalent object is replaced with the given one.

Parameters:
value - the object to place in the set
Returns:
nullOk; the old equivalent value in the set, or null if there was no such object
Throws: NullPointerException
thrown if value == null
remove 
 public Object remove(Object value)
Removes the given object (or its equivalent, according to the set's equal function) from the set. This does nothing if the object is not actually in the set.

Parameters:
value - the object to remove
Returns:
nullOk; the old value in the set or null if there was no such object
Throws: NullPointerException
thrown if value == null
removeOne 
 public Object removeOne()
This removes and returns one element from the set. If there are no elements in the set, this returns null.

Returns:
nullOk; a value removed from the set or null if the set is empty
clear 
 public void clear()
This clears out the set so that it has no elements in it.

performEquals 
 public abstract boolean performEquals(Object o1,
                                       Object o2)
This method must be overridden by subclasses to define the way to compare two objects for equality.

Parameters:
o1 - an object to compare
o2 - the object to compare o1 to
Returns:
true if the two objects should be considered equal in the eyes of the set
performHashCode 
 public abstract int performHashCode(Object value)
This method must be overridden by subclasses to define the way to get a hashCode.

Parameters:
value - the value whose hashCode is desired
Returns:
the hashCode of the value
